nu.dll.lyskom
Class Session

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--nu.dll.lyskom.Session
All Implemented Interfaces:
AsynchMessageReceiver, RpcEventListener, RpcReplyReceiver
public class Session
extends java.lang.Object
implements AsynchMessageReceiver, RpcReplyReceiver, RpcEventListener

Session class. This handles connection, logging in, querying unreads, createing texts, and a whole bunch of other stuff

STATE_DISCONNECTED

public static final int STATE_DISCONNECTED
Not connected to a LysKOM server

STATE_CONNECTED

public static final int STATE_CONNECTED
Connected to a LysKOM server, but not logged in. In this state only a few calls can be made to the server (lookupName and login)

STATE_LOGIN

public static final int STATE_LOGIN
Connected, and logged in as a specific user

getGlobalUnreadInConf

public int[] getGlobalUnreadInConf(int conf)
                            throws java.io.IOException
Supposed to return an array of global text number for all unreads in a conference. Generally not a good idea. Not used.

login

public boolean login(int id,
                     java.lang.String password,
                     boolean hidden)
              throws java.io.IOException
Logs on to the LysKOM server.
Parameters:
id - ID number of the person to log in as
password - corresponding password
hidden - if true, session will not be broadcasted on LysKOM LysKOM call: login

nextUnreadConference

public int nextUnreadConference(boolean change)
                         throws java.io.IOException
Returns the conference number of the next conference that _may_ contain an unread text.
Parameters:
change - if true, this method also calls changeConference()

nextUnreadText

public int nextUnreadText(boolean updateUnread)
                   throws java.io.IOException
Returns the global text number of the next unread text in the current conference. Returns -1 if there are no unread texts.
Parameters:
updateUnread - if true, also marks the returned text as read NOTE: This method is _very_ inefficient and expensive on the server, most notably the use of localToGlobal() for each text is very stupid.

getReadTexts

public ReadTextsMap getReadTexts()
Returns a ReadTextsMap object. The ReadTextsMap should be rethought.

markAsRead

public void markAsRead(int confNo,
                       int[] localTextNo)
                throws java.io.IOException
Marks a text as read on the LysKOM server. Note that the text number is local.
Parameters:
confNo - conference number
localTextNo - local text number LysKOM call: mark-as-read

doMarkAsRead

public RpcCall doMarkAsRead(int confNo,
                            int[] localTextNo)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Constructs and sends the RPC call for markAsRead().

getText

public Text getText(int textNo)
             throws java.io.IOException
Returns a Text object corresponding to the specified global text number. If the text has been cached earlier, the cached copy will always be returned.
Parameters:
textNo - Global text number LysKOM call: get-text

doLocalToGlobal

public RpcCall doLocalToGlobal(int confNo,
                               int firstLocalNo,

                        throws java.io.IOException

localToGlobal

public TextMapping localToGlobal(int confNo,
                                 int firstLocalNo,
                                 int noOfExistingTexts)
                          throws java.io.IOException
Returns a TextMapping that can be used to convert local text number in a conference to global text numbers. See the "local-to-global" RPC call and the "Text-Mapping" data structure in the LysKOM specification for more information. See doLocalToGlobal() LysKOM call: local-to-global, but without the limitation that noOfExistingTexts must be between 1-255 inclusive

                                int confNo)

getTextStat

public TextStat getTextStat(int textNo)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Returns a TextStat object for a given text number, or null if the text doesn't exist or is inaccessible. As with getText(), getTextStat() also currently always returns a cached object if available. LysKOM call: get-text-stat

doCreateText

public RpcCall doCreateText(byte[] text,
                            Selection miscInfo,
                            AuxItem[] auxItems)
                     throws java.io.IOException
Creates a text on the LysKOM server. Sort of works, actually.
Parameters:
text - byte-array containing the article text
miscInfo - Selection with Misc-Info stuff (recipients, etc)
auxItems - Auxiallry items (Aux-Item) attached to this article LysKOM call: create-text

               throws java.io.IOException
Wrapper for other createText()

createText

public int createText(java.lang.String text,
                      int rcpt)
               throws java.io.IOException
Another method for creating text. Doesn't work too well, should be removed, I guess.

lookupName

public ConfInfo[] lookupName(java.lang.String name,
                             boolean wantPersons,
                             boolean wantConfs)
                      throws java.io.IOException
lookup names of persons/conferences.
Parameters:
name - (sub)string naming the person(s)/conference(s)
wantPersons - Return persons matching @tt{name}
wantConfs - Return conferences matching @tt{name} LysKOM call: lookup-z-name
